title: Effect of drug on melanoma cells Set Member 1

content.description:
Melanocytes are skin cells that can become cancerous and develop into a cancer known as melanoma. Some cancerous melanocytes have developed resistance to the drugs currently used to treat melanoma. As a result, researchers are investigating the effects of a new compound (drug <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) on four different melanoma cell lines. Researchers analyzed cell survival in two cell lines (Figure 1) and oxygen consumption in the presence of drug <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in all four cell lines (Figure 2). Figure 3 shows the proposed mechanism by which drug <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> affects cells.

Figure 1. Percent survival of normal melanocytes and cancerous melanocyte (melanoma) lines <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> after treatment with different concentrations of drug <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Figure 2. Oxygen consumption per cell in four melanoma lines after treatment with either solvent alone or solvent containing drug <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Error bars represent <math alttext="plus or minus 2 S E sub x bar" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mo>±</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mtext>SE</mtext></mrow><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Figure 3. Pathway leading to cell survival, growth, and proliferation and the likely effect of drug <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Which of the following best describes the data in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: As the concentration of drug <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increases, there is an increase in melanoma cell survival.

At a concentration above <math alttext="10 micromolar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>10</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, drug <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> reduces melanoma cell survival.

At a concentration below <math alttext="25 micromolar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, drug <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increases survival in all melanoma cell lines.

At a concentration of <math alttext="25 micromolar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, drug <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a greater effect on melanoma line <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> than on melanoma line <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: At a concentration above <math alttext="10 micromolar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>10</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, drug <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> reduces melanoma cell survival.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
